name: 地理學方法論
description:
This course focuses on five aspects: the meaning of research, logic in research, research design, data acquisition and analysis, and thesis writing. Each of the aspects is illustrated as the follows:

Unit 1: Meaning of Research: 
Need for scientific research, types of research, approaches to geographical research:  identification fields, sub fields and themes.

Unit 2: Logic in Research: 
Inductive vs. reductive approaches; hypotheses, concepts and facts, principles, law, theory and their implications in geographical research and trends in geography.

Unit 3: Research Design:
Selection of the topic; statement of the problem; formulation of hypotheses and testing; views and theories; literature survey and the role of internet and bibliography; time schedule.

Unit 4: Data Acquisition and Analysis: 
Collection of data; sources of data: primary and secondary; structuring the data; data transformation; sampling techniques; interpret the results; quantitative revolution in geography; qualitative methods and changes in geographical research.

Unit 5: Thesis Writing:
Organization of the thesis: the preliminaries, the text and the reference materials – drafting of thesis: first, second and final – final evaluation; language and presentation (form and style); writing of abstract, research papers for seminar and journal publications.
goals: 認識地理學研究設計與相適應的方法論之關係與重要性
熟習地理學方法論的重要發展與理路
能依據研究主題與目標而設定研究方法與實踐規劃
能具體設計並實踐研究所需的步驟並實踐之
